meanings.definition: A person who lives by asking for money or food.
meanings.sent1: The mendicants in the village always received help from kind neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The mendicants outside the temple humbly asked for donations.
meanings.sent3: The mendicants decided to have a race to see who could collect the most coins.
meanings.sent4: The mendicants' pleas echoed through the streets, reaching the hearts of passersby.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mendicants with their outstretched hands stayed in the minds of the townspeople.

meanings.sent1: During the festival, the mendicants lined up to receive alms from the attendees.
meanings.sent2: The act of mendicants was seen as a way to survive in tough times.
meanings.sent3: The mendicants' constant requests for treats made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with the voices of mendicants seeking help.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the mendicants' worn clothes tugged at the generosity of the townsfolk.
